intro: Guillainia minor, commonly known as the small guillainia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of vibrant red or orange flowers. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine, hairy texture. Guillainia minor thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny environments.
